aashnadogra: I'm a bisexual, everyone knows this except for my immediate family. They think people from LGBTQ are psychologically ill or in their words "mental". And even though they don't know about my sexuality, I have never felt ashamed of being one because I know what I am, nothing they think or say will change that. The second you realise and accept your truth, there is absolutely nothing that the world can do to bring you down. Abso-fuckin-lutely nothing. I have had the privilege to know the people from my community and to be honest, acceptance is the key to moving forward. The hardest part of going through something is that we take too much time in accepting it. The second we accept it, the "problem" becomes null, it doesn't have power over you and that my friend, is freedom.
